item.title: Columnar format Parquet structure and read optimization
item.description: Parquet is a columnar format mainly used in the Hadoop ecosystem. Compared to row-based formats like CSV, unnecessary columns can be skipped. Besides, there is a mechanics to read only rows that are needed, so queries can be executed efficiently. Format Rows are horizontally partitioned into some Row Groups, and the Column Chunks of each column are arranged in order. Column Chunks are divided into Pages, and compression and encoding are performed in that unit.
